column4: Hey, I've got a machine here I've just installed Xubuntu 8.04 on. It's a Celeron 1.7Ghz with 256MB RAM and it's hammering the hard-drive every time I try and do something. Is this a configuration problem or hardware?
if it's that fresh of an install it's probably just indexing
Wouldn't that happen in one big bunch though? This only happens when I open something.
By indexing you mean updatedb, right?
no .. tracker.. updatedb belongs to "locate".. tracker is the new  one.
ah hah. I must read about how it works.
yes.. it uses iptables to do it.
is there a gui to turn it off?
what are you trying to do that you can't?
I'm having trouble getting an IP from dhcp. Can get the network if I set it static and I can see the request for an address on the router, but it doesn't accept the response.
the firewall wouldn't be preventing that. but it was a good thought.  Is this a wireless connection?
DHCP had a reservation for the MAC with the wrong hostname. Switched it to the correct hostname and everything came good.
having said that, *is* there somewhere to modify the firewall, for future reference?
nice one, thanks. I've played with iptables a bit in the past for masquerading, so I'm not entirely unfamiliar.
